title: 112_hr6697
content: The Consumer Bounty Act, also known as the Toxic Substances Control Act, has been amended to include a provision for consumer bounty in civil actions. Plaintiffs who prevail in such cases will be awarded a minimum of $10,000 to be paid by the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs will split the award based on their time spent on the case, and multiple defendants will be jointly and severally liable. SEC. 3. AMENDMENT TO THE SURFACE MINING CONTROL AND RECLAMATION ACT OF 1977: In civil actions under this section, plaintiffs who prevail will receive a minimum of $10,000 from the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs will split the award based on their time spent on the case. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 4. AMENDMENT TO THE FEDERAL WATER POLLUTION CONTROL ACT: In civil actions under this section, plaintiffs who prevail will receive a minimum of $10,000 from the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs will split the award based on their time spent on the case. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 5. AMENDMENT TO THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT: In civil actions under this section, plaintiffs who prevail will receive a minimum of $10,000 from the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs will split the award based on their time spent on the case. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 6. AMENDMENT TO THE MARINE PROTECTION, RESEARCH, AND SANCTUARIES ACT OF 1972: In civil actions, plaintiffs who prevail will receive a minimum of $10,000 from the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs will split the award based on their time spent on the case. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 7. AMENDMENT TO THE NOISE CONTROL ACT OF 1972: In civil actions under this section, plaintiffs who prevail will receive a minimum of $10,000 from the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs will split the award based on their time spent on the case. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 8. AMENDMENT TO THE ENERGY POLICY AND CONSERVATION ACT: In civil actions, plaintiffs who prevail will receive a minimum of $10,000 from the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs split the award based on time spent. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 9. AMENDMENT TO THE SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL ACT: In civil actions under this section, prevailing plaintiffs will receive a minimum of $10,000 from the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs split the award based on time spent. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 10. AMENDMENT TO THE CLEAN AIR ACT: Adds a provision for a Consumer Bounty in civil actions under this section, awarding prevailing plaintiffs a minimum of $10,000 to be paid by the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs split the award based on time spent. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 11 amends the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 to include a provision for a Consumer Bounty in civil actions, awarding prevailing plaintiffs a minimum of $10,000 to be paid by the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs split the award based on time spent. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 12 amends the Powerplant and Industrial Fuel Use Act of 1978 to include a provision for Consumer Bounty in civil actions, awarding prevailing plaintiffs a minimum of $10,000 to be paid by the defendants. Multiple plaintiffs split the award based on time spent. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 13 amends the Emergency Planning and Community Right-To-Know Act of 1986 to include a provision for awarding prevailing plaintiffs not less than $10,000 in civil actions. Multiple plaintiffs split the award based on time spent. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 14 amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act. SEC. 14 amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act by adding a provision for awarding prevailing plaintiffs not less than $10,000 in civil actions. Multiple plaintiffs split the award based on time spent. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable. SEC. 15 amends the Pipeline Safety Act. SEC. 15 amends the Pipeline Safety Act to include a provision for awarding prevailing plaintiffs not less than $10,000 in civil actions. Multiple plaintiffs split the award based on time spent. Multiple defendants are jointly and severally liable.
